Lack enough support: The claim that a family of four can make up to $88,000 a year and still get a subsidy for health insurance lacks sufficient evidence or data to support it.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that under the new federal health care law, families with an income of $88,000 or less will qualify for a subsidy, without providing any evidence or explanation for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider or provide any alternative explanations for how subsidies for health insurance under the new federal health care law are funded or who bears the cost in the long run.
